snippet: By maintaining its cheaper currency, the lei, Romania has made its exports — two-thirds of which go to the euro zone — more competitive and secured a lower cost of living.
abstract: Romania is one of several former Communist states that have proved remarkably resilient in weathering European economic crisis; euro crisis has helped such states due to fact that they have kept their own currencies, and many of them are having second thoughts about their long-running goal of joining the euro.
lead_paragraph: By maintaining its cheaper currency, the lei, Romania has made its exports — two-thirds of which go to the euro zone — more competitive and secured a lower cost of living.

headline.main: Resilient Romania Finds a Currency Advantage in a Crisis
headline.print_headline: Resilient Romania Finds Advantage in a Crisis
